messages.original:
On the northeastern flank of Pokrovsk, Russian forces have achieved another localised breakthrough and have cut the railway line from Dobropillya. 
Russian continued to push from the Fedorivka-Boikivka area and captured numerous positions in the forests and treelines on the tactical heights to the west. They advanced into and quickly captured Zatyshok, before immediately pushing southwest to Sukhetske which was also captured. Other positions in the surrounding areas were seized, and a general push to the railway line was made, resulting in a ~2.7km long section of it and the trench lines running parallel to it coming under Russian control.
Russian DRGs then began moving into northern Rodynske, carrying out operations in both the dachas and the northern residential areas. As a result northern Rodynske is currently in the grey zone. Additionally, by exploiting a gap in the trench lines, Russian forces began advancing towards the train station, although it's unclear if they achieved any success. 
To the north, the Russian were able to complete the capture of Nykanorivka by pushing outwards from their foothold in the southern houses, and from the newly captured positions in the forests to the east. They then went on to establish control over the forests west and north of the village, and began attacking the freight train station at Dorozhnje. DRGs have already begun infiltrating the city of Bilytske from the east
Additionally, Russian forces cleared the rest of the salient west of Razine, recapturing the treeline positions there, and entered the eastern part of Chervonyi Lyman. 
+ ~26.40km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russian forces have broken through to the northeastern outskirts of Siversk again, and captured an important trench strongpoint. 
They have had more success so far than any of their previous failed attempts at entering the city, and the fighting has significantly intensified. It's possible that an attempt to capture Siversk is underway.
1 Russian Tu-22M3 strategic bomber is airborne from Shaykovka Airbase in Kaluga Oblast, flying to the launch lines in the Black Sea. It is currently over Rostov Oblast.
1 Russian Tu-22M3 strategic bomber is airborne from Shaykovka Airbase in Kaluga Oblast, flying to the launch lines in the Black Sea. It is currently over Rostov Oblast.
Correction: Its flying over southern Crimea, heading for the launch lines southwest of Sevastopol.
Correction: Its flying over southern Crimea, heading for the launch lines southwest of Sevastopol.
They made a U-turn at Feodosia and are now flying back past Cape Chauda on a northeastern course, being escorted by 2 Su-35s.
They made a U-turn at Feodosia and are now flying back past Cape Chauda on a northeastern course, being escorted by 2 Su-35s.
They appear to be flying to Mozdok Airbase, North Ossetia.

The battle for Toretsk has likely officially begun today.

Russian forces have captured the city of Toretsk, Kostyantynivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~30,914.
Total land area: ~14.40km¬≤
The battles for the city lasted 362 days, just 3 days short of a year. Toretsk is the largest settlement Russia has captured so far this year.
High threat of Iskander launches from Kursk Oblast.
High threat of Iskander launches from Kursk Oblast.

No launches are expected for now. A Russian reconnaissance drone has been hovering over the village of Nosivka, Chernihiv Oblast for the past 15 minutes, and is not moving away. Launches in the next few hours are possible.

No launches are expected for now. A Russian reconnaissance drone has been hovering over the village of Nosivka, Chernihiv Oblast for the past 15 minutes, and is not moving away. Launches in the next few hours are possible.
All clear for Chernihiv Oblast and other regions under threat. Alarms will be lifted in around 9 minutes. Reconnaissance work on Nosivka continues with no changes.
All clear for Chernihiv Oblast and other regions under threat. Alarms will be lifted in around 9 minutes. Reconnaissance work on Nosivka continues with no changes.

The reconnaissance drone hasn't found anything yet. It's filming different parts of the village, and is now hovering over the centre in the area of the supermarket and gymnasium. There are other recon drones in Chernihiv Oblast, including one near the city of Mena.

The reconnaissance drone hasn't found anything yet. It's filming different parts of the village, and is now hovering over the centre in the area of the supermarket and gymnasium. There are other recon drones in Chernihiv Oblast, including one near the city‚Ä¶

The path it's taking is indicative of it searching for something. It was last recorded over the village of Stepovi Khutory, flying on a southeastern course towards the regional border with Kyiv Oblast.
Hey, at least Ukraine is getting a 66:1 Kill ratio according to the best articulated and professional source who still uses Zaluzhnyi in every thumbnail.

Satellite imagery reveals that since June, work has begun on Donetsk International Airport. 
The trenches that ran over the runway have been covered, and construction work is underway at the abandoned carparks, possibly in preparation for installing fuel tanks. Additionally, construction work can be seen at the destroyed hypermarket next to the airport, although it's unclear if this is military related or just for restoration purposes. 
Some are saying that these new actions are to transform the destroyed airport into a Geran-2 drone launch point, although it is known that launches of Gerans have been taking place from a training ground near Donetsk City for the past two weeks already, although this will be further east than the airport. 
Donetsk International Airport was the epicentre of battles in 2014-2015 (where is sustained almost all of its damage) and remained on the frontline until the fall of Avdiivka in February 2024. At the closest point, it is roughly 35km away from the frontline.
